page.title: 03EMPLOYMENT IN FLEETWOOD 1985
page.content: From using survey questionnaires and interviews on five separate occasions with Fleetwood residents and visitors, we found that of residents questioned 20% commented, unprompted, on the loss of jobs in the fishing industry and in shipping, 75% thought that unemployment was a major problem in Fleetwood and 55% that unemployment had increased during the past two years. Asked to name the town's main source of work, 60% said I.C.I., 12% said Pandoro, 16% said the docks or the container berth, 4% said in-shore fishing, and 8% said there was none, just unemployment. Despite an awareness of Fleetwood's problems, 48% commented on the recent and current work to improve the sea wall, Marina, town centre and Park. They believe in their motto:{ONWARD}.
